section.title: dataRef property
section.para: Original data reference - holds the NMTOKEN key to the original data string contained in the value array of the "originalData" object that contains the original data for a given inline code.
Value description: An [XML Schema Datatypes] NMTOKEN that must be the value of the NMTOKEN key of one of the array items within the "originalData" object in the same in the same unit object.

listitem.para: it points to an NMTOKEN property of the originalData object in the same unit.
optionally it can also reference a corresponding NMTOKEN property of the originalDataDir object.

section.programlisting:
<unit id="1"> <originalData> <data id="d1">{0}</data> </originalData> <segment> <source>Error in '<ph id="1" dataRef="d1"/>'.</source> <target>Erreur dans '<ph id="1" dataRef="d1"/>'.</target> </segment> </unit>
"subfiles": [ { "id": "1", "originalData": { "d1": "{0}", "d2" : "{1}" }, "subunits": [ { "kind": "segment", "source": [ { "text": "Error in '" }, { "id": "1", "kind": "ph", "dataRef": "d1"}, {"text" : " and "}, { "id": "2", "kind": "ph", "dataRef": "d2"}, { "text": "'." } ] } ] } ]
section.para: The example above shows a ph object that has its original data stored outside the content, in a anonymous "originaldata" object.
